item.title: Lagarde Says ECB Sees ‘Really Good Progress’ on Inflation So Far
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- President Christine Lagarde said the European Central Bank is “rather satisfied” with how inflation has slowed to below the 2% goal targeted by officials. Speaking on Wednesday at an event hosted by the Atlantic Council in Washington, she described how policymakers have seen consumer-...

item.title: ECB’s Lane Says Disinflation in the Euro Area Is Well on Track
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Disinflation in the euro area is making progress, according to European Central Bank Chief Economist Philip Lane. ECB policymakers have emphasized “high conviction that the disinflation process is well on track, but at the same time we have a projection of unemployment remaining low, ...

item.description: (Bloomberg) -- European Central Bank Governing Council member Joachim Nagel said officials are keeping all their options open when it comes to the next interest-rate moves, declining to speculate whether a bigger cut may be necessary in the future. “This discussion about 25 or maybe something differ...

item.title: BlackRock Sees South African Asset Rally as Tactical Opportunity
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc., the world’s biggest asset manager, sees the recent rally in South African assets as a tactical opportunity, though talk of economic reforms need to be translated into concrete measures for those gains to continue. The classification of South Africa, which has benefite...

item.title: Saudi Arabia Taps BlackRock to Build Mortgage-Backed Securities Market
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Saudi Arabia is turning to the world’s biggest fund manager to help it develop a market for mortgage-backed securities as the kingdom looks to improve the affordability of its housing stock. The country hopes developing a secondary market for mortgages would allow banks to offer borr...

item.title: ECB’s Holzmann Says Current Data Don’t Justify Bigger Cut: CNBC
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- European Central Bank Governing Council member Robert Holzmann said current economic conditions don’t justify cutting interest rates by 50 basis points at December’s meeting — even though some policymakers will probably put that option on the table. “I saw the change that we had, the...

item.title: ECB Nod Is ‘Catalyst’ for UniCredit’s Commerzbank Move, Mediobanca Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- UniCredit SpA’s move on Commerzbank AG will probably come to a head once the Italian lender gets approval from the European Central Bank to increase its existing stake, a Mediobanca analyst said. The ECB nod “should be a catalyst for the deal,” Andrea Filtri said in a note on Wednesda...

item.title: European Bonds Rally as Traders Add to Bets on Big ECB Rate Cut
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- European short-dated bonds rallied as traders added to wagers that the European Central Bank will lower interest rates by half a percentage point in December, in a bid to prop up the bloc’s flagging economy. The yield on German two-year notes fell as much as eight basis points to 2.10...

item.title: ECB Starts to Discuss If Rates Need to Go Below Neutral: Reuters
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- European Central Bank officials are starting to debate whether interest rates will need to be lowered to a level that stimulates economic activity, Reuters reported, citing people it didn’t identify. While any consensus is still some way off, the report said that a small but growing ...

item.title: The 'Irresistible' Real Estate Bet Gripping Investors
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- There’s a niche corner of dealmaking that’s quietly making inroads in the battered market for commercial real estate. item.title: ECB’s Lingering Inflation Risks Warrant Caution, Patsalides Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank has room to lower borrowing costs further as inflation approaches its target but must pay close attention to upside risks, according to Governing Council member Christodoulos Patsalides. item.title: Goldman Cuts Indian Stocks as UBS Says It’s Time to Buy the Dip

item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Analysts are becoming more divided on the outlook for India’s stock market after an 11-month wining streak.
